summary.span: 实现文件传输协议 (FTP) 客户端。

span.span: Implements a File Transfer Protocol (FTP) client.

remarks.format: ## Remarks > [!IMPORTANT] > 建议不要将 `FtpWebRequest` 类用于新的开发。We don't recommend that you use the `FtpWebRequest` class for new development. 有关 `FtpWebRequest`的详细信息和替代方法，请参阅 GitHub 上的[WebRequest 不应使用](https://github.com/dotnet/platform-compat/blob/master/docs/DE0003.md)。For more information and alternatives to `FtpWebRequest`, see [WebRequest shouldn't be used](https://github.com/dotnet/platform-compat/blob/master/docs/DE0003.md) on GitHub. 若要获取 的实例，请使用 方法。To obtain an instance of , use the method. 你还可以使用 类从 FTP 服务器上传和下载信息。You can also use the class to upload and download information from an FTP server. 使用上述任一方法时，如果指定使用 FTP 方案的网络资源（例如 `"ftp://contoso.com"`）， 类就能以编程方式与 FTP 服务器交互。Using either of these approaches, when you specify a network resource that uses the FTP scheme (for example, `"ftp://contoso.com"`) the class provides the ability to programmatically interact with FTP servers. 该 URI 可以是相对路径或绝对 URI。The URI may be relative or absolute. 如果 URI 的格式为 `"ftp://contoso.com/%2fpath"` （% 2f 是转义的 "/"），则 URI 为绝对 URI，当前目录为 `/path`。If the URI is of the form `"ftp://contoso.com/%2fpath"` (%2f is an escaped '/'), then the URI is absolute, and the current directory is `/path`. 但是，如果 URI 的格式 `"ftp://contoso.com/path"`，则首先 .NET Framework 登录到 FTP 服务器（使用 属性设置的用户名和密码），然后将当前目录设置为 `/path`。If, however, the URI is of the form `"ftp://contoso.com/path"`, first the .NET Framework logs into the FTP server (using the user name and password set by the property), then the current directory is set to `/path`. 必须为服务器提供有效的用户名和密码，否则服务器必须允许匿名登录。You must have a valid user name and password for the server or the server must allow anonymous logon. 您可以通过设置 属性来指定用于连接到服务器的凭据，也可以在传递给 方法的 URI 的 部分包含这些凭据。You can specify the credentials used to connect to the server by setting the property or you can include them in the portion of the URI passed to the method. 如果在 URI 中包含 信息，则 属性将设置为具有指定用户名和密码信息的新网络凭据。If you include information in the URI, the property is set to a new network credential with the specified user name and password information. > [!CAUTION] > 除非 `true` 属性，否则所有数据和命令（包括你的用户名和密码信息）都将以明文形式发送到服务器。Unless the property is `true`, all data and commands, including your user name and password information, are sent to the server in clear text. 监视网络流量的任何人都可以查看凭据并使用它们连接到服务器。Anyone monitoring network traffic can view your credentials and use them to connect to the server. 如果要连接到需要凭据的 FTP 服务器并支持安全套接字层（SSL），则应将 设置为 "`true`"。If you are connecting to an FTP server that requires credentials and supports Secure Sockets Layer (SSL), you should set to `true`. 您必须具有 才能访问 FTP 资源;否则，会引发 异常。You must have to access the FTP resource; otherwise, a exception is thrown. 通过将 属性设置为 结构中定义的值来指定要发送到服务器的 FTP 命令。Specify the FTP command to send to the server by setting the property to a value defined in the structure. 若要传输文本数据，请将 属性从其默认值（`true`）更改为 `false`。To transmit text data, change the property from its default value (`true`) to `false`. 有关详细信息和限制，请参阅 。For details and restrictions, see . 使用 对象将文件上载到服务器时，必须将文件内容写入通过调用 方法或其异步对应方法（ 和 方法获取）的请求流。When using an object to upload a file to a server, you must write the file content to the request stream obtained by calling the method or its asynchronous counterparts, the and methods. 在发送请求之前，必须写入流并关闭流。You must write to the stream and close the stream before sending the request. 通过调用 方法或 和 方法，将请求发送到服务器。Requests are sent to the server by calling the method or its asynchronous counterparts, the and methods. 当请求的操作完成时，将返回 的对象。When the requested operation completes, an object is returned. 对象提供了操作的状态以及从服务器下载的任何数据。The object provides the status of the operation and any data downloaded from the server. 您可以使用 "" 属性设置一个用于读取或写入服务器的超时值。You can set a time-out value for reading or writing to the server by using the property. 如果超过超时期限，则调用方法会引发 ，并将 设置为 。If the time-out period is exceeded, the calling method throws a with set to . 从 FTP 服务器下载文件时，如果命令成功，则所请求文件的内容可用于响应对象的流中。When downloading a file from an FTP server, if the command was successful, the contents of the requested file are available in the response object's stream. 可以通过调用 方法访问此流。You can access this stream by calling the method. 有关详细信息，请参阅 。For more information, see . 如果 属性设置为直接或在配置文件中，则通过指定的代理建立与 FTP 服务器的通信。If the property is set, either directly or in a configuration file, communications with the FTP server are made through the specified proxy. 如果指定的代理是 HTTP 代理，则仅支持 、和 命令。If the specified proxy is an HTTP proxy, only the , , and commands are supported. 仅缓存下载的二进制内容;也就是说，使用 命令接收的内容，其 属性设置为 `true`。Only downloaded binary content is cached; that is, content received using the command with the property set to `true`. 如果可能，多个 将重复使用现有连接。Multiple s reuse existing connections, if possible. 有关 FTP 协议的详细信息，请参阅[RFC 959：文件传输协议](https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc959.txt)。For more information about the FTP protocol, see [RFC 959: File Transfer Protocol](https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc959.txt). ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何从 FTP 服务器中删除文件。The following code example demonstrates deleting a file from an FTP server. [!code-cpp[NCLFtpClient#4](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLFtpClient/CPP/ftptests.cpp#4)] [!code-csharp[NCLFtpClient#4](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLFtpClient/CS/ftptests.cs#4)] 下面的代码示例演示如何使用 类从 FTP 服务器下载文件。The following code example demonstrates downloading a file from an FTP server by using the class. [!code-cpp[NCLFtpClient#5](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLFtpClient/CPP/ftptests.cpp#5)] [!code-csharp[NCLFtpClient#5](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLFtpClient/CS/ftptests.cs#5)] 下面的代码示例演示如何使用异步操作将文件上载到 FTP 服务器。The following code example demonstrates using asynchronous operations to upload a file to an FTP server. [!code-cpp[NCLFtpAsync#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLFtpAsync/CPP/async.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[NCLFtpAsync#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLFtpAsync/CS/async.cs#1)]

summary.span: 终止异步 FTP 操作。

span.span: Terminates an asynchronous FTP operation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果没有正在进行的操作，此方法不执行任何操作。If there is no operation in progress, this method does nothing. 如果文件传输正在进行，则此方法将终止传输。If a file transfer is in progress, this method terminates the transfer. > [!NOTE] > 当你在应用程序中启用网络跟踪后，此成员将输出跟踪信息。This member outputs trace information when you enable network tracing in your application. 有关详细信息，请参阅[.NET Framework 中的网络跟踪](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md)。For more information, see [Network Tracing in the .NET Framework](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md). ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示了用户可以如何终止从本地目录到服务器的异步文件上传。The following code example demonstrates how the user can terminate an asynchronous upload of a file from the local directory to the server. [!code-cpp[NCLFtpClient#10](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLFtpClient/CPP/ftptests.cpp#10)] [!code-csharp[NCLFtpClient#10](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLFtpClient/CS/ftptests.cs#10)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 必须通过调用 方法来完成异步操作。You must complete the asynchronous operation by calling the method. 通常， 由 `callback`所引用的方法调用。Typically, is called by the method referenced by `callback`. 若要确定操作的状态，请检查由此方法返回的 对象中的属性。To determine the state of the operation, check the properties in the object returned by this method. 在等待流时，此方法不会被阻止。This method does not block while waiting for the stream. 若要阻止，请调用 替换此方法。To block, call in place of this method. 有关使用异步编程模型的详细信息，请参阅[以异步方式调用同步方法](~/docs/standard/asynchronous-programming-patterns/calling-synchronous-methods-asynchronously.md)。For detailed information about using the asynchronous programming model, see [Calling Synchronous Methods Asynchronously](~/docs/standard/asynchronous-programming-patterns/calling-synchronous-methods-asynchronously.md). > [!NOTE] > 当你在应用程序中启用网络跟踪后，此成员将输出跟踪信息。This member outputs trace information when you enable network tracing in your application. 有关详细信息，请参阅[.NET Framework 中的网络跟踪](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md)。For more information, see [Network Tracing in the .NET Framework](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md). ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何开始异步操作以获取请求的流。The following code example demonstrates beginning an asynchronous operation to get a request's stream. 此代码示例是为 类概述提供的更大示例的一部分。This code example is part of a larger example provided for the class overview. [!code-cpp[NCLFtpAsync#4](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLFtpAsync/CPP/async.cpp#4)] [!code-csharp[NCLFtpAsync#4](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLFtpAsync/CS/async.cs#4)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 必须通过调用 方法来完成异步操作。You must complete the asynchronous operation by calling the method. 通常， 由 `callback`所引用的方法调用。Typically, is called by the method referenced by `callback`. 若要确定操作的状态，请检查 方法返回的 对象中的属性。To determine the state of the operation, check the properties in the object returned by the method. 如果 属性设置为直接或在配置文件中，则通过指定的代理建立与 FTP 服务器的通信。If the property is set, either directly or in a configuration file, communications with the FTP server are made through the specified proxy. 在等待服务器的响应时， 不会阻止。 does not block while waiting for the response from the server. 若要阻止，请调用 方法代替 。To block, call the method in place of . 有关使用异步编程模型的详细信息，请参阅[以异步方式调用同步方法](~/docs/standard/asynchronous-programming-patterns/calling-synchronous-methods-asynchronously.md)。For more information about using the asynchronous programming model, see [Calling Synchronous Methods Asynchronously](~/docs/standard/asynchronous-programming-patterns/calling-synchronous-methods-asynchronously.md). 当你在应用程序中启用网络跟踪后，此成员将输出跟踪信息。This member outputs trace information when you enable network tracing in your application. 有关详细信息，请参阅[.NET Framework 中的网络跟踪](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md)。For more information, see [Network Tracing in the .NET Framework](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md). > [!NOTE] > 如果引发了 ，请使用异常的 和 属性来确定来自服务器的响应。If a is thrown, use the and properties of the exception to determine the response from the server. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何结束异步操作以获取请求的流，然后启动请求以获取响应。The following code example demonstrates ending an asynchronous operation to get a request's stream, and then starting a request to get the response. 此代码示例是为 类概述提供的更大示例的一部分。This code example is part of a larger example provided for the class overview. remarks.format: ## Remarks 在初始 SSL 连接协商过程中，客户端证书用于对客户端进行身份验证。Client certificates are used to authenticate the client during the initial SSL connection negotiation. 有关详细信息，请参阅 。For more information, see . > [!NOTE] > .NET Framework 在创建 SSL 会话时将其缓存，并尝试为新请求重用缓存会话（如果可能）。The .NET Framework caches SSL sessions as they are created and attempts to reuse a cached session for a new request, if possible. 尝试重用 SSL 会话时，.NET Framework 使用 的第一个元素（如果有），或者如果 为空，则尝试重复使用匿名会话。When attempting to reuse an SSL session, the .NET Framework uses the first element of (if there is one), or tries to reuse an anonymous session if is empty.

span.span: Gets or sets the name of the connection group that contains the service point used to send the current request.

value.span: 包含连接组名称的 值。

span.span: A value that contains a connection group name.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 连接组将一组请求与特定连接或连接集相关联。Connection groups associate a set of requests with a particular connection or set of connections. 连接组中的连接只能由同一应用程序域中的请求重复使用，前提是请求上的凭据相同，并且请求指定连接组名称。The connections in a connection group can be reused only by requests originating in the same application domain, when the credentials on the request are the same and the request specifies the connection group name. 如果请求未指定连接组名称，则可以使用与连接组不关联的任何已请求服务器的现有连接。When a request does not specify a connection group name, any existing connection to the requested server that is not associated with a connection group can be used. 如果凭据不相同，则会关闭现有连接，必须重新对新请求进行身份验证。When the credentials are not the same, the existing connection is closed and the new request must be reauthenticated. 使用连接组可以提高性能，因为这允许用户的所有请求重用使用用户凭据进行身份验证的连接。Using connection groups can improve performance because this allows all of the requests for a user to reuse the connection authenticated with the user's credentials. 在调用 、、或 方法之后更改 属性会导致 异常。Changing the property after calling the , , , or method causes an exception. ## Examples 下面的代码示例检索此属性的值。The following code example retrieves the value of this property. remarks.format: ## Remarks 从 FTP 服务器下载文件时，设置 "" 属性。Set the property when downloading a file from an FTP server. 此偏移量指示服务器文件中用于标记要下载的数据开始位置的位置。This offset indicates the position in the server's file that marks the start of the data to be downloaded. 偏移量指定为从文件开头开始的字节数;第一个字节的偏移量为零。The offset is specified as the number of bytes from the start of the file; the offset of the first byte is zero. 设置 会导致 向服务器发送重新启动（`REST`）命令。Setting causes the to send a restart (`REST`) command to the server. 如果要将数据上传到服务器，则多数 FTP 服务器实现将忽略此命令。This command is ignored by most FTP server implementations if you are uploading data to the server. 在调用 、、或 方法之后更改 将导致 异常。Changing after calling the , , , or method causes an exception. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何从服务器下载部分文件，并将下载的数据追加到本地文件。The following code example demonstrates downloading part of a file from a server and appending the downloaded data to a local file. remarks.format: ## Remarks 仅缓存使用 命令接收的内容。Only content received using the command is cached. 下表描述了 FTP 缓存策略对 的影响。The following table describes the effects of FTP caching policies on . |策略Policy|效果Effect| |------------|------------| ||如果资源是最新的，则返回缓存的资源，内容长度准确，并且存在过期、修改和内容长度属性。Returns the cached resource if the resource is fresh, the content length is accurate, and the expiration, modification, and content length attributes are present.| ||从服务器返回资源。Returns the resource from the server.| ||如果内容长度存在并且与条目大小匹配，则返回缓存的资源;否则，会引发 。Returns the cached resource if the content length is present and matches the entry size; otherwise, throws a .| ||如果提供了内容长度并与条目大小匹配，则返回缓存的资源;否则，将从服务器下载资源，并将其返回给调用方。Returns the cached resource if the content length is provided and matches the entry size; otherwise, the resource is downloaded from the server and is returned to the caller.| ||如果缓存资源的时间戳与服务器上资源的时间戳相同，则返回缓存的资源;否则，将从服务器下载资源，并将其存储在缓存中，并将其返回给调用方。Returns the cached resource if the timestamp of the cached resource is the same as the time stamp of the resource on the server; otherwise, the resource is downloaded from the server, stored in the cache, and returned to the caller.| ||从服务器下载资源，将其存储在缓存中，并将资源返回给调用方。Downloads the resource from the server, stores it in the cache, and returns the resource to the caller.| ||如果缓存的资源存在，则将其删除。If a cached resource exists, it is deleted. 从服务器下载资源，并将其返回给调用方。The resource is downloaded from the server and is returned to the caller.| > [!NOTE] > 设置 重写任何配置设置。Setting overrides any configuration setting.

remarks.format: ## Remarks ### .NET Framework 上On .NET Framework 属性标识与 FTP 服务器通信的 实例。The property identifies the instance that communicates with the FTP server. 代理由系统通过使用配置文件和 Internet Explorer 局域网设置进行设置。The proxy is set by the system by using configuration files and the Internet Explorer Local Area Network settings. 若要指定不应使用代理，请将 设置为 方法返回的代理实例。To specify that no proxy should be used, set to the proxy instance returned by the method. 有关自动代理检测的详细信息，请参阅[自动代理检测](~/docs/framework/network-programming/automatic-proxy-detection.md)。For more information about automatic proxy detection, see [Automatic Proxy Detection](~/docs/framework/network-programming/automatic-proxy-detection.md). 在将数据写入请求的流或获取响应之前，必须设置 。You must set before writing data to the request's stream or getting the response. 在调用 、、或 方法之后更改 将导致 异常。Changing after calling the , , , or method causes an exception. 类支持 HTTP 和 ISA 防火墙客户端代理。The class supports HTTP and ISA Firewall Client proxies. 如果指定的代理是 HTTP 代理，则仅支持 、和 命令。If the specified proxy is an HTTP proxy, only the , , and commands are supported. ### .NET Core 上的On .NET Core `FtpWebRequest.Proxy` 属性不受支持。The `FtpWebRequest.Proxy` property is not supported. 设置属性不起作用。Setting the property has no effect. 获取属性值将返回 `null`。Getting the property value returns `null`. ## Examples 下面的代码示例显示此属性值。The following code example displays this property value. remarks.format: ## Remarks 写入 方法返回的流或从 方法返回的流中读取时，将使用 。The is used when writing to the stream returned by the method or reading from the stream returned by the method. 具体而言， 属性控制 方法的超时，此方法用于读取 方法返回的流，并用于读取用于写入 方法返回的流的 方法。Specifically, the property controls the time-out for the method, which is used to read the stream returned by the method, and for the method, which is used to write to the stream returned by the method. 如果超过超时期限，则调用方法会引发 ，并将 设置为 。If the time-out period is exceeded, the calling method throws a with set to . 若要指定等待请求完成的时间量，请使用 属性。To specify the amount of time to wait for the request to complete, use the property.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 若要指定无限值，请将 属性设置为 （-1）。To specify an infinite value, set the property to (-1). 此为默认值。This is the default value. 是使用 方法发出的同步请求等待响应并且 方法等待流的毫秒数。 is the number of milliseconds that a synchronous request made with the method waits for a response and that the method waits for a stream. 如果资源在超时期限内未响应，则请求会引发 ，并将 属性设置为 ""。If a resource does not respond within the time-out period, the request throws a with the property set to . 在调用 、、或 方法之后更改 将导致 异常。Changing after calling the , , , or method causes an exception. 域名系统（DNS）查询可能需要长达15秒钟的时间来返回或超时。如果你的请求中包含需要解析的主机名，并且你将 设置为小于15秒的值，则可能需要15秒或更长时间，然后才会引发 来指示请求超时。A Domain Name System (DNS) query may take up to 15 seconds to return or time out. If your request contains a host name that requires resolution and you set to a value less than 15 seconds, it may take 15 seconds or more before a is thrown to indicate a time-out on your request. ## Examples 下面的代码示例设置此属性。The following code example sets this property. span.span: to indicate to the server that the data to be transferred is binary; to indicate that the data is text.

value.span: 默认值为 。

span.span: The default value is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果要发送二进制数据（如图像），请将此属性设置为 `true`。If you are sending binary data, such as an image, set this property to `true`. 如果要发送文本，请将属性设置为 `false`。If you are sending text, set the property to `false`. 指定 `true` 会导致 向服务器发送 `"TYPE I"` 命令。Specifying `true` causes the to send a `"TYPE I"` command to the server. 指定 `false` 会导致 向服务器发送 `"Type A"` 命令。Specifying `false` causes the to send a `"Type A"` command to the server. FTP 服务器可以忽略这些命令。FTP servers can ignore these commands. 在调用 、、或 方法之后更改 将导致 异常。Changing after calling the , , , or method causes an exception. ## Examples 下面的代码示例检索并显示指定 对象的属性值。The following code example retrieves and displays property values for a specified object. summary.span: 获取或设置客户端应用程序的数据传输过程的行为。

span.span: Gets or sets the behavior of a client application's data transfer process.

value.span: 如果客户端应用程序的数据传输过程侦听数据端口上的连接，则为 ；如果客户端应在数据端口上启动连接，则为 。

span.span: if the client application's data transfer process listens for a connection on the data port; otherwise, if the client should initiate a connection on the data port.

value.span: 默认值为 。

span.span: The default value is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 将 属性设置为 `true` 将 "`PASV"` 命令发送到服务器。Setting the property to `true` sends the "`PASV"` command to the server. 此命令请求服务器侦听数据端口并等待连接，而不是在接收到传输命令时启动连接。This command requests the server to listen on a data port and to wait for a connection rather than initiate one upon receipt of a transfer command. 有关使用 指定的行为的说明，请参阅[RFC 959： "文件传输协议"、第3.2 节： "建立数据连接" 和第4.1.2 节： "传输参数命令"](https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc959.txt)。For a description of the behaviors that are specified using , see [RFC 959: "File Transfer Protocol", Section 3.2: "Establishing Data Connections" and Section 4.1.2: "Transfer Parameter Commands"](https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc959.txt). 在调用 、、或 方法之后更改 将导致 异常。Changing after calling the , , , or method causes an exception. 如果 设置为 `true`，FTP 服务器可能不会发送文件的大小，并且下载进度始终可以为零。If is set to `true`, the FTP server may not send the size of the file, and download progress can always be zero. 如果 设置为 `false`，则防火墙可能会引发警报并阻止文件下载。If is set to `false`, a firewall can raise an alert and block the file download. ## Examples 下面的代码示例检索并显示指定 对象的属性值。The following code example retrieves and displays property values for a specified object.
